column3: Lali-ho! Welcome to Tomra, friend. If you've any questions to ask, then I'm your dwarf!
What kind of place is this?
I was a miner once, but my days of swinging a pick came to an end when my back got too old and twisted. Now I'm just enjoying my golden years!
I sit here, drinking good dwarven ale, and pass the time boasting about whose beard is best. Mine may be old, but it ain't lost none of its bounce!
This village is home to the Tholl family.

We mostly make a living from what we dig out of the mines. You'll also see a few hunters and farmers around the place, not to mention our automata─those are the metal helpers what we build to assist with our daily tasks.

Oh, one word of advice if you're headed east: take care around them Goggs. You can't trust dwarves with wild, wiry beards like that lot! Just the sight of them shifty buggers is enough to make my whiskers curl... <spit>
